title: The Reactive Spring Book
html:
I don't know how you would build architectures today without reactive programming. Once you've gone reactive, it's super hard to go back, because - deep down - you know you can deliver more performant, robust, resilient, scalable software with reactive. Why would you do otherwise? I love reactive programming, because it makes writing production-worthy software easier and faster. In this book, Reactive Spring, I'll show you why by introducing the wide world of reactive Spring.

Follow @ReactiveSpring on Twitter for more

title: Cloud Native Java
html:
I wrote this book with my buddy Kenny Bastani. It's all about how to build applications that survive and thrive in the cloud in terms of Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, and cloud technologies like Cloud Foundry. Consider this your one-stop shop for building cloud-native applications. It's available in a number of languages (left to right, top to bottom): English, Chinese, Korean, and Russian.

Follow @CloudNativeJava on Twitter for more

title: Apress' Pro Spring Recipes
html: I was so very lucky enough in 2010 to be picked to update Gary Mak's epic tome Spring Recipes. The book has been updated several time since, and is a great recource for folks who want to have a recipe-centric approach to building Spring applications.
